results.title: Energy Conservation in the Home
results.creator_credit: Dept of Minerals and Energy AV Workshop
results.brief_description:
“Energy conservation in the home” provides useful information on the ways in which energy can be saved within the household.

See also Related Title 325491 “Victoria’s energy”; uses stills to analyse Victoria’s energy position during 1980-81.

results.title: Energy Conservation in the Home
results.brief_description: Showing friends over their new house, a couple discuss the ways in which they are conscious of saving energy through both the design and sensible usage of the home

results.title: Energy and work
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Larry Trust
results.brief_description: Defines energy, potential energy and kinetic energy. Shows how energy is expounded and stored and how energy can be changed from one form to another. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description: Defines energy, potential energy and kinetic energy. Shows how energy is expounded and stored and how energy can be changed from one form to another. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Energy and matter
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Joseph Koenig and Robert Verrall
results.brief_description: A look at energy and what it is, designed to encourage understanding and experimentation among even the youngest of budding physicists. This film pictures energy in familiar forms - light, heat, motion, etc. - and shows its origin in the sun. The illustration is cartoon-style, with color and movement appealing to youthful imaginations.

results.title: Energy and it's transformations
results.brief_description: Briefly explains and illustrates potential, kinetic and radiant energy in mechanical, chemical and thermal forms, conservation of energy, power and work.

results.title: Energy and agriculture
results.creator_credit: CSIRO, Nicholas Alexander and Chris Oliver
results.brief_description: Suggests ways of cutting down on energy use in agriculture. Shows how technological change and scientific research can expand the man-on-the-land’s role of producing food energy to the production of liquid fuels such as methanol and ethanol.
results.description: Suggests ways of cutting down on energy use in agriculture. Shows how technological change and scientific research can expand the man-on-the-land’s role of producing food energy to the production of liquid fuels such as methanol and ethanol.

results.title: Energy
results.brief_description: Shows the mining of coal, its conversion into electrical energy, and the problems enocuntered in this conversion such as the disposal of waste products. Also looks at atomic power stations and their inherent problems. The concept of tidal power as an alternative source is mentioned. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.description: Shows the mining of coal, its conversion into electrical energy, and the problems enocuntered in this conversion such as the disposal of waste products. Also looks at atomic power stations and their inherent problems. The concept of tidal power as an alternative source is mentioned. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Energy
results.creator_credit: Oxford Films (U.S.), Arthur G. Evans and Barbara Buce
results.brief_description: Explores energy in humans, animals, the elements and the earth. Shows how these kinds of energy are harnessed and how they are used daily in home and industry. Shows that pollution is a result of excessive use and barren devastation is a result of a lack of conservation. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Energetics of life
results.creator_credit: FilmFair Communications, Mallory Pearce, Daniel E. Atkinson and E.A. Carlson
results.brief_description: Treats the types and functions of energy in living things - kinetic and potential energy; thermodynamics; free energy and chemical energy. Described in detail are the structure and function of the ATP molecule; photosynthesis; the metabolism of glucose. Emphasizes the ability of the ATP molecule to harness solar energy and use it

results.title: Energetically yours
results.creator_credit: Transfilm, Walter Lowendahl and David Hilberman
results.brief_description: An animated film by Ronald Searle which traces man’s search for sources of energy to help him in his daily life. It tells of our need and use of energy since primitive times - from fire, through coal and oil, to the atom.
results.description: An animated film by Ronald Searle which traces man’s search for sources of energy to help him in his daily life. It tells of our need and use of energy since primitive times - from fire, through coal and oil, to the atom.
